III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation When a youth was placed at the facility between 9/25/18 and
6/27/19, a staff member sexually assaulted another youth and
made sexual comments. Staff would only use one person for
restraints. The male staff would rub up against the female youth
from behind during a restraint. A supervisor was told of the
concerns and never responded.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Former Foster Care Supervisor (FFCS) was interviewed via
phone on 5/8/25. FFCS reported Youth A was a youth on her
foster care caseload in the past when FFCS was a foster care
worker and a foster care supervisor. However, FFCS reported she
never managed Youth A’s case when Youth A was placed at the
facility. FFCS reported she supports Youth A emotionally and
financially now that Youth A is an adult and no longer has an open
foster care case. FFCS reported Youth A’s cousin’s foster care
case remains open and was flagged when complaints came in
about the facility, so FFCS was asked to reach out to Youth A and
ask her about her time at the facility from 2018-2019. FFCS
reported when she reached out to Youth A, Youth A provided her
with the allegations.
Youth A was interviewed via phone on 5/8/25. Youth A reported
she was placed at the facility, in Beata Hall, from 2018-2019.
Youth A reported Staff 1 was really rude and physical with her and
2

other youth. Youth A reported Staff 1 did a restraint on her on the
day she arrived at the facility because she was refusing to get out
of Foster Care Worker’s (FCW) car since she didn’t want to be at
the facility. Youth A reported Staff 1 restrained her from behind
and it was like he wanted her to feel his private parts when he was
restraining her. Youth A reported Staff 1 did this type of restraint to
all the female youth at the facility. Youth A reported Staff 1 also
restrained youth in a more angry and aggressive way. Youth A
reported the more she showed frustration, the angrier Staff 1
would become. Youth A reported restraints are always supposed
to be done by two staff and if they’re restraining a female youth,
it’s always supposed to be a male and a female staff. Youth A
reported every time Staff 1 worked, he was verbally aggressive
and never gave the youth choices. Youth A reported Staff 1 made
frequent sexual comments towards female youth and would touch
female youth in a sexual way (such as standing behind them
during a restraint).
Youth A reported the facility would require new youth to shower
with the shower curtains open and a staff watching them for the
first 30 days after admission. Youth A reported there should have
never been male staff in the bathroom with female youth, but male
staff would also watch new youth in the showers with the shower
curtain open.
Youth A reported Supervisor 2 wasn’t a regular employee in Beata
Hall, but he would report if there was an emergency. Youth A
reported Supervisor 2 would frequently be present at Henry Ford
School. One time, Supervisor 2 took Youth A and Youth B to the
bathroom, and he stood at the door to the bathroom listening to
them go to the bathroom. Youth A reported Supervisor 2 didn’t sit
in a chair outside the bathroom but would stand in the bathroom
so he could hear them.
Youth A reported she told FCW, Supervisor 1 and Therapist all
these concerns during the time she was placed at the facility.
Youth A reported Therapist would help her as much as she could
and Therapist would pass the concerns along to Supervisor 1, but
nothing was ever taken care of. Youth A reported Supervisor 1
never addressed any of her concerns. Youth A reported she
completed written grievances about all these situations, so there
should be a record of her concerns. Youth A reported Therapist,
Staff 3, and Staff 4 would have knowledge of these issues and
incidents.
3

Youth B was interviewed via phone on 5/8/25. Youth B reported
she was placed at the facility on and off from age 8 to age 17, so
she spent a lot of time there. Youth B reported she was placed at
the facility from 2018-2019 in Beata Hall and remembered Youth
A. Youth B reported she remembered Staff 1 because he was
someone she looked up to because he reminded her of a father-
figure a little bit. Youth B reported she never heard or saw Staff 1
say or do anything inappropriate to her or any of the other female
youth at the facility. Youth B reported Staff 1 would have
“wandering eyes” sometimes, but she thinks it’s because he was a
little cross-eyed, so he couldn’t help it. Youth B reported the only
situation she ever heard about (but didn’t see) was maybe Staff 1
put too much of his weight on a female youth (couldn’t remember
who) during a restraint, but Youth B couldn’t remember the
situation or circumstances.
Youth B reported she was never restrained while at the facility.
Youth B reported staff were not allowed to do one-person
restraints, and she never saw any staff do one-person restraints.
Youth B reported she sometimes saw staff do one-person escorts
where they would hold a youths’ arm to go from one place to
another, but it wasn’t a restraint. Youth B reported she never saw
Staff 1 complete one-person restraints by standing behind a
female youth and holding them or rubbing his private parts against
them. Youth B reported one time she saw a female youth (couldn’t
remember who) being restrained by Staff 10 and Staff 10 had the
female youth’s butt pressed directly against his private parts.
Youth B reported she couldn’t remember where this occurred in
the hall or who else was around. Youth B reported the only other
situation where she had a concern was when a youth (couldn’t
remember who) was slammed to the ground really hard and hit
her head. Youth B reported Staff 10, Staff 11, an unknown female
staff, and an unknown male staff were involved (Investigated
under SIR #2019CO108025 dated 12/26/18).
Youth B reported she never heard or saw anything about youth
having to shower with the shower curtain open and staff watching
for the first 30 days after admission. Youth B reported if staff were
sitting outside the bathroom, they would be unable to see the
showers from the door. Youth B reported male staff were never
allowed in the bathroom and she never saw any male staff in the
bathroom. Youth B reported only female staff came in the
bathroom, but she never saw female staff watching any youth
shower.
4

Youth B reported Supervisor 1 was the first employee to interview
her when Youth B was admitted to the facility at 8 years old. Youth
B reported most youth didn’t like Supervisor 1 because she didn’t
let the youth get into trouble and didn’t give into them at all. Youth
B reported Supervisor 1 wasn’t well-liked because she was 100%
a hard worker and did everything by the book. Youth B reported
Supervisor 1 wasn’t too hard on them, but she was someone who
wanted the best for the youth and she showed it by being strict
towards them. Youth B reported Supervisor 1 always addressed
situations or concerns between youth and other youth or between
youth and staff. Youth B reported Supervisor 1 never let anything
go, and always made sure the youth were taken care of.
Attempts were made to interview Youth C via phone on 5/8/25
and 5/22/25 via phone. Voicemails were left for Youth C as she
was placed at the facility from 2018-2019; however, Youth C did
not return contact. Youth C is currently an adult and does not have
an open foster care or juvenile justice case.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) for Youth A was interviewed via
phone on 5/8/25. FCW reported she remembers Youth A but
doesn’t remember any facility staff names. FCW reported she
doesn’t remember if Youth A had any specific concerns about her
placement at the facility because Youth A complained about every
placement she was in. FCW reported she doesn’t want to belittle
any complaints Youth A had but wants it to be known Youth A had
frequent complaints. FCW reported the day she brought Youth A
to the facility, Youth A refused to get out of the car. After a very
long time (can’t remember how long), facility staff assisted FCW in
getting Youth A to go into the building. FCW reported it wasn’t a
single individual who helped Youth A get into the building, but a
group of staff. FCW reported she vaguely remembers a male staff
picking Youth A up and carrying her to the door of the unit she
was going to, but she couldn’t remember what he looked like or
any other details. FCW reported Youth A complained about some
facility staff but couldn’t remember who or what specifically the
complaints were about. FCW reported Youth A would say things
like “I don’t like being restrained”, “I hate it here”, “I don’t need to
be in residential”, and “I don’t like staff”, but the complaints were
all very general. FCW reported she doesn’t remember Youth A
making any complaints regarding male staff doing or saying
sexually inappropriate things. FCW doesn’t recall Youth A
complaining about male staff watching youth shower for the first
30 days after admission. FCW reported Therapist never
mentioned Youth A had any concerns while placed at the facility.
5

Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via phone on
5/22/25. CA reported she was not the CA in 2018-2019 but
worked in Beata Hall during that timeframe. CA reported she does
not remember Youth A but remembers Staff 1. CA reported she
thinks there might have been an investigation involving Staff 1 but
cannot remember what the situation was.
CA reported she didn’t witness Staff 1 do or say anything
inappropriate towards the youth at the facility. CA reported one-
person restraints were not allowed at the facility, and she cannot
remember any incidents with specific youth or staff where one-
person restraints occurred back then. CA reported she never saw
or heard anything about male staff restraining youth from behind
and rubbing their private parts against the youth.
CA reported there was never a rule/policy/procedure where staff
had to watch youth shower with the shower curtain open for the
first 30 days after admission. CA reported male staff were not
allowed in the bathrooms at all. CA reported male staff couldn’t
even go in the bathroom if a youth was on 100% observations for
suicide watch or safety concerns. CA reported female staff were
the only ones who could complete those observations.
Nurse was interviewed via phone on 5/22/25. Nurse reported
she was the campus nurse in 2019, and presently still works at the
facility. Nurse does not remember Staff 1 or Youth A. Nurse
reported she never received any complaints of male staff rubbing
against youth from behind or she would have reported it. Nurse
reported there was never a rule staff had to watch youth shower
with the shower curtain open for the first 30 days after admission,
and she never heard any complaints involving this situation.
Therapist was interviewed via phone on 5/12/25. Therapist
reported she remembers Youth A and Staff 1. Therapist reported
there were comments being made by different youth in the facility
stating they felt uncomfortable around Staff 1, but she can’t
remember any specific youth who complained about him.
Therapist reported some youth (can’t remember who) would say
Staff 1 would improperly restrain them, but youth said the same
thing about a lot of staff. Therapist reported she can’t remember if
Youth A was one of the youth who complained about Staff 1’s
restraints. Therapist reported she never witnessed Staff 1 do or
say anything inappropriate towards the youth. Therapist can’t
remember if Youth A ever complained about Staff 1 doing or
saying anything inappropriate. Therapist reported she cannot
6

remember if Youth A ever complained about Staff 1 being
aggressive towards her.
Therapist reported she made complaints about many different
staff, but not all of them were serious complaints or complaints
which required further action. Therapist reported if she received
any serious allegations about any staff, she completed incident
reports and would make a report to CPS, if necessary.
Therapist reported there was never a rule staff had to watch youth
shower with the shower curtain open for the first 30 days after
admission, and she never heard any complaints involving this
situation.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 5/22/25. Staff 1 reported
he worked in Beata Hall in 2018-2019 but doesn’t remember
Youth A. Staff 1 reported he never said anything inappropriate
towards any youth or grabbed/touched any youth inappropriately.
Staff 1 reported he wanted to work at the facility to diversify his
resume by working with female youth. However, he knew when he
began working with female youth, he had to be a “straight shooter”
so there would be no confusion, lines crossed, blurred lines, etc.
Staff 1 reported he was very clear with his boundaries with youth.
Staff 1 reported if he had to speak to a female youth, he always
ensured a female staff was present as well. Staff 1 reported he
never had any complaints or allegations brought against him by
youth and was never involved in any investigations for any
concerns.
Staff 1 reported he never restrained a youth to get them out of a
car and he never carried a youth into one of the buildings. Staff 1
reported those are recipient rights violations, and staff could get
terminated for something like that. Staff 1 reported one-person
restraints were never allowed, and staff always had to wait for a
second staff to arrive before completing a restraint. Staff 1
reported he never witnessed any male staff rubbing up against
youth from behind during a restraint and never heard about it
occurring.
Staff 1 reported there was never a rule staff had to watch youth
shower with the shower curtain open for the first 30 days after
admission. Staff 1 reported if youth ever needed 1:1 staffing due
to safety issues, it could only be female staff. Staff 1 reported
male staff could never be in the bathrooms.
7

Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 was one of the most professional
people he has worked with over the last 20 years. Staff 1 reported
she always took youths’ complaints seriously and addressed them
quickly. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 knew her stuff and was
always on point. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 was a stickler for
the rules and made sure staff did things by the book.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 5/12/25. Staff 2 reported
he worked in Beata Hall as a direct care staff in 2018 and was
promoted to a supervisor sometime in 2019. Staff 2 reported he
doesn’t remember Youth A but remembers Staff 1. Staff 2
reported he never witnessed Staff 1 do or say anything
inappropriate to any youth. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was flirtatious
towards some of the female staff, but never anything to the point
of needing to take it to human resources.
Staff 2 reported one-person restraints were not allowed, and he
never witnessed any one-person restraints occur. Staff 2 reported
he never witnessed any male staff rubbing up against youth from
behind during a restraint.
Staff 2 reported he never heard of any situations involving youth
being required to keep the shower curtain open while showering
for the first 30 days after admission. Staff 2 reported even when
youth were on 100% observation, female staff would accompany
youth to the bathroom and sit in the bathroom but would not watch
them with the shower curtain open. Staff 2 reported male staff
were never allowed to go into the bathroom unless there were no
youth present, and staff needed to retrieve an item from the
hygiene closet.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 5/12/25. Staff 3 reported
she worked in Beata Hall in 2018-2019 and remembers Youth A
and Staff 1. Staff 3 reported Youth A never complained about the
facility to her and never brought up any concerns, issues or
complaints regarding staff to her. Staff 3 reported Youth A was a
good kid and had some issues with peers at times, but never with
staff.
Staff 3 reported she never had any concerns about Staff 1’s
interactions with youth. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 was really good
with the youth and had an excellent rapport with them. Staff 3
reported she never heard any youth complain about him. Staff 3
reported she never witnessed Staff 1 do or say anything
inappropriate towards youth. Staff 3 reported had she witnessed
8

anything or heard about any concerns, she would have completed
an incident report and contacted CPS.
Staff 3 reported one-person restraints were not allowed, and she
never saw any occur. Staff 3 reported they had great staff in 2018-
2019, and the staff had good rapport with youth, so restraints were
infrequent as de-escalation was usually sufficient. Staff 3 reported
she never heard about or witnessed any male staff rubbing up
against youth from behind during a restraint.
Staff 3 reported there was never a rule staff had to watch youth
shower with the shower curtain open for the first 30 days after
admission. Staff 3 reported male staff were not allowed in the
bathrooms and could never be left alone with female youth.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 5/22/25. Staff 4 reported
she worked in Beata Hall in 2018-2019 and presently still works at
the facility. Staff 4 reported she remembers Youth A and Staff 1.
Staff 4 reported Staff 1 was a great staff because he was firm and
did his job. Staff 4 reported she worked closely with Staff 1 and
never witnessed him do or say anything inappropriate with any
youth. Staff 4 reported she would never associate with anyone
who did anything inappropriate. Staff 4 reported she never heard
any youth complain about Staff 1 except when he wouldn’t let
them do something they wanted to do.
Staff 4 reported one-person restraints were not allowed, and she
never saw any occur. Staff 4 reported she never heard about or
witnessed any male staff rubbing up against youth from behind
during a restraint.
Staff 4 reported there was never a rule staff had to watch youth
shower with the shower curtain open for the first 30 days after
admission. Staff 4 reported male staff were never allowed in the
bathrooms, even if a youth was on 100% observations for suicide
watch or safety concerns.
Staff 4 reported Supervisor 1 held Beata Hall together for many
years and she took care of the youth and staff very well. Staff 4
reported she never had any concerns about Supervisor 1 not
taking youth complaints seriously or not taking care of the
complaints brought to her attention. Staff 4 reported Supervisor 1
truly cared for all the youth and staff she encountered.
9

Attempts were made to interview Staff 5 via phone on 5/8/25
and 5/22/25. Voicemails were left for Staff 5; however, Staff 5 did
not return contact.
Staff 6 was interviewed via phone on 5/12/25. Staff 6 reported
he has worked at the facility since 2005 and worked in Beata Hall
in 2018-2019. Staff 6 reported he vaguely remembers Youth A
and remembers Staff 1. Staff 6 reported he heard rumors about
Staff 1 having a close, suspicious relationship with one of the
female youth (can’t remember who), and showed her a lot of
attention such as bringing her food at the facility. Staff 6 reported
he was a team lead, so he was privy to more information in his
role. Staff 6 reported he was informed a conversation about
boundaries might have been held with Staff 1, but he cannot
remember who held the conversation or who informed him a
conversation occurred. Staff 6 reported he never witnessed Staff 1
do or say anything inappropriate to any youth.
Staff 6 reported one-person restraints were not allowed at the
facility, and he never saw any occur. Staff 6 reported he never
witnessed any male staff rubbing up against youth from behind
during a restraint. Staff 6 reported restraints were only to be done
on a youth’s arms, so restraints were always with a staff on either
side of the youth, but never from behind.
Staff 6 reported he never heard of any situations involving youth
being required to keep the shower curtain open while showering
for the first 30 days after admission. Staff 6 reported female staff
were the only staff allowed near the bathrooms. Staff 6 reported if
a youth was placed on 100% observations due to suicidal
ideations/attempts, only female staff could complete those
observations. Staff 6 reported male staff could never be alone with
youth; not even to transport a youth from one building to another.
Staff 7 was interviewed via phone on 5/12/25. Staff 7 reported
she was a floater staff in 2018-2019, and presently still works at
the facility. Staff 7 reported she doesn’t remember Youth A, but
she remembers Staff 1. Staff 7 reported she never saw or heard
any concerns regarding Staff 1’s interactions with youth, and no
youth complained about him.
Staff 7 reported one-person restraints were not allowed, and she
never saw any occur. Staff 7 reported she never heard about any
male staff restraining female youth from behind and rubbing their
private parts against the youth and never saw anything like that
occur.
10

Staff 7 reported there was never a rule/policy/procedure where
staff had to watch youth shower with the shower curtain open for
the first 30 days after admission. Staff 7 reported male staff were
never allowed in the bathrooms with female youth and she never
heard about male staff being in the bathroom with female youth.
Staff 8 was interviewed via phone on 5/12/25. Staff 8 reported
he worked in Beata Hall in 2018-2019 and presently still works at
the facility. Staff 8 reported he doesn’t remember Youth A, but he
remembers Staff 1. Staff 8 reported he never saw or heard
anything concerning about Staff 1’s interactions with youth.
Staff 8 reported one-person restraints were not allowed, and if he
would have seen one, he would have stopped it. Staff 8 reported
he never heard about any male staff restraining female youth from
behind and rubbing their private parts against the youth and never
saw anything like that occur. Staff 8 reported restraints were
always completed with staff on either side of the youth, and never
from behind.
Staff 8 reported there was never a rule/policy/procedure where
staff had to watch youth shower with the shower curtain open for
the first 30 days after admission. Staff 8 reported only female staff
were allowed in the bathrooms and she never heard about male
staff being in the bathrooms. Staff 8 reported the only time staff
would have to be in the bathroom with a youth was if a youth was
on 100% observation due to safety concerns, but only female staff
were allowed to do it.
Staff 9 was interviewed via phone on 5/12/25. Staff 9 reported
he worked in Beata Hall in 2018-2019 but doesn’t remember
Youth A or Staff 1. Staff 9 reported he never heard about any
male staff restraining female youth from behind and rubbing their
private parts against the youth and never saw anything like that
occur. Staff 9 reported one-person restraints were not allowed and
he never saw any one-person restraints occur.
Staff 9 reported there was never a rule/policy/procedure where
staff had to watch youth shower with the shower curtain open for
the first 30 days after admission. Staff 9 reported male staff were
never allowed in the bathrooms with female youth and she never
heard about male staff being in the bathrooms. Staff 9 reported if
a youth had an issue in the bathroom, female staff were required
to report.
11

Staff 10 was unable to be interviewed as there was no phone
number in his employee file. Staff 10 no longer works at the
facility.
Staff 11 was unable to be interviewed as there was no phone
number in his employee file. Staff 11 no longer works at the
facility.
Attempts were made to interview Staff 12 via phone on
5/12/25 and 5/22/25. Voicemails/text messages were left for Staff
12; however, Staff 12 did not return contact.
Attempts were made to interview Supervisor 1 via phone on
5/12/25 and 5/22/25. Voicemails were left for Supervisor 1;
however, Supervisor 1 did not return contact.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via phone on 5/12/25. Supervisor
2 reported from 2018-2019, he was a floating supervisor, so
sometimes he would work in Beata Hall, but he was not there all
the time. Supervisor 2 reported he vaguely remembers Youth A
and he remembers Staff 1. Supervisor 2 reported he never
witnessed or heard about Staff 1 doing or saying anything
inappropriate towards any youth.
Supervisor 2 reported one-person restraints were not allowed and
he never heard about or saw any staff complete one-person
restraints. Supervisor 2 reported had he seen or heard about a
one-person restraint happening, he would have addressed it
immediately.
Supervisor 2 reported he was never at the Henry Ford school
working because he was a supervisor, and only staff were
assigned to work at the school. Supervisor 2 reported he never
brought any youth to the bathroom at the school because he did
not go to the school.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• MiSACWIS did not have any restraint or incident reports for
Youth A, Youth B, or Youth C.
• MiSACWIS did not have any intakes for complaints from or
regarding Youth A and the facility prior to this investigation.
• DCWL special investigation report allegations from
September 2018-December 2020 were reviewed and none
of the investigations completed included Youth A or any of
12

the allegations made by Youth A. There were no
allegations against Staff 1 or Supervisor 1 in any
investigations completed.
• Youth A’s Residential Initial Service Plan (September-
October 2018) authored by Therapist documented Youth A
had one incident of verbal and physical aggression towards
staff, but there were no reports of staff difficulties, or any
other concerns noted.
• Youth A’s Residential Updated Service Plan (January-April
2019) authored by Therapist documented Youth A had no
incidents of physical or verbal aggression, and there were
no concerns noted regarding interactions with staff.
• Youth A’s Updated Service Plan (9/1/18-11/27/18) authored
by FCW documented Youth A had contact with FCW on
9/27/18, 10/3/18, 10/30/18, and 11/9/18. Youth A reported
she enjoyed the unit, but didn’t want to stay at the facility
because she wanted to be with family. No concerns were
noted about the facility or staff.
• Youth A’s Updated Service Plan (11/28/18-2/22/19)
authored by FCW documented Youth A had contact with
FCW on 12/3/18, 12/7/18, 1/10/19, 1/24/19, 2/11/19 and
2/15/19. Youth A reported things have been going okay and
she has worked hard to stay on track. Youth A reported
things were going well at the facility and she was not
having any issues there.
• Youth A’s Updated Service Plan (2/23/19-5/21/19) authored
by FCW documented Youth A had FCW on 3/14/19,
3/15/19, and 4/24/19. Youth A reported things were going
well, she was happy at the facility and really liked the
progress she was making and what she was working on.
Youth A reported she was doing well at the facility and no
concerns were noted.
• Facility Incident Reports involving Youth A from 2018-2019
do not note any of the concerns Youth A alleged during this
investigation. Out of the 11 incident reports completed by
the facility involving Youth A, documentation shows Youth
A was only restrained on one occasion (10/1/18). The
narrative of the restraint report supported it was a two-
person restraint, and Staff 1 was not involved. It should be
noted one incident report (dated 1/3/19) documented Youth
13

A and Youth B plotted to make false allegations against
Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 13 (regarding staff allowing youth
to use staff cell phones) to get them fired because Youth B
was upset about a consequence plan of action she
received due to her behavior.
• Email from Administrator dated 5/13/25 notes there were
no records of any complaints (grievances) from Youth A
while she was placed at the facility.
• Behavior Management Policy states the facility strictly
prohibits excessive or inappropriate use of behaviors
management intervention. Staff are only permitted to utilize
approved behavior management techniques. Consumer
Rights Officer must be contacted immediately if there is
suspicion a youth’s rights were violated or if there was
inappropriate use of behavior management techniques.
• Employee Behavior Policy states employees are always
expected to conduct themselves in a positive, professional,
and respectful manner. Staff are to treat all youth in a
manner which supports trauma informed practices and
always demonstrate behavior that exhibits and professional
boundaries. Staff are to report any suspicious, unethical, or
illegal conduct by co-workers to management. Prohibited
behaviors include engaging in any form of sexual or other
forms of harassing behavior, and any
abuse/neglect/mismanagement of any youth.
• Staff and Client Interaction Policy states all staff should
conduct themselves in a professional and appropriate
manner when interacting with youth. Female staff should be
involved in daily scheduled activities whenever possible.
Staff should never present themselves in a manner that
could be construed as flirtatious or sexually aggressive to
youth.
• Staff 1 does not have any disciplinary actions in his
employee file. Staff 1 was terminated in 2020 because he
was a contingent staff and did not work at the facility for
